Description
The Digital Health Innovation Lab (DHIL) at BC Children's Hospital undertakes trans-disciplinary research with engineers, computer scientists, and healthcare providers, focusing on developing and applying new technologies. We aim to extract clinically useful information from vital signs and other clinical data and transform them into information that allows clinicians to make more effective and efficient decisions and empowers patients to take a more active role in their care.

We are hiring a student to help us analyze clinical, research, and diagnostic data extracted from clinical registries, Electroencephalogram (EEG), and MRI Recordings for children who underwent epilepsy corrective surgery and develop a supervised predictive model for predicting seizure freedom after epilepsy surgery.

The student's tasks and responsibilities will include
Analyzing the datasets for artifacts and outliers and assessing the quality of the datasets
Data cleaning, visualization, and feature engineering to prepare the data for further analysis and interpretation
Implementing natural language processing (NLP) pipelines to extract clinically relevant information from clinical reports

Analyze the processed data to develop predictive models (i.e., positive or negative outcomes after epilepsy surgery) and evaluate the models
Attend and participate in all relevant team meetings
Interpreting results and assisting with drafting abstracts, reports, and scientific articles for peer-reviewed journals
Presenting findings at departmental rounds and local/national conferences
Communicate and report progress with research teams and clinicians
Comply with all institutional policies for research with human subjects
Supervision One of the Co-Investigators of the project, Dr. Matthias Görges, will provide supervision. The trainee will work alongside other team members, including graduate students, summer students, and research staff. The incumbent will be expected to exercise considerable initiative in fulfilling a work plan.
Complexity Duties will be of moderate-to-high complexity and require attention to detail and accuracy to support a variety of tasks, projects, and events. Training and assistance will be available until new tasks are mastered.

Company Background and Culture

With headquarters in Vancouver, Canada, Taseko Mines Limited is a leading North American copper producer across a range of key dimensions operational efficiency; low energy and GHG intensity, environmentally sound, socially responsible development; healthy and safe workplaces and communities.

The Company's foundational asset is the long-life, low-cost Gibraltar copper mine (100% owned) in south-central British Columbia, for which it has won numerous environmental and safety awards for operational excellence. Gibraltar is a state-of-the-art facility and the second largest open pit copper mine in Canada, with a 700+ person workforce. Gibraltar produces an average of 130 million pounds of copper and 2.5 million pounds of molybdenum each year, with mineral reserves sufficient for more than 20 years of future operations.

Taseko is also advancing the Florence Copper Project in Arizona - a near-term copper producer with an unparalleled energy, water and GHG profile per unit of production. Florence Copper is a unique 'in-situ copper recovery' project which, once operating, will significantly increase Taseko's copper production. Once fully operational, the project will have a production capacity of 85 million pounds of copper per year over a 20-year mine life.

The Yellowhead Project is a large, long-life copper project that Taseko added to its development portfolio in 2019.
